p: The effects of different DPI concentrations were observed to determine whether ROS focal accumulation is a key mechanism that suppresses effector BAS4:eGFP expression. As the DPI concentration increased from 0 to 5 Î¼M, total ROS production and focal accumulation gradually decreased ( Figure S3A,C). At the same time, BAS4:eGFP expression restored from concentration-dependent growth of avirulent P. oryzae invasive hyphae ( Figure S3B,D), and the percentage of healthy invasive hyphae increased from 8% to 60% ( Figure S3D). These combined results suggest that ROS focal accumulation has a pivotal role in maintaining plant immunity by effectively inhibiting effector BAS4 expression in avirulent P. oryzae invasive hyphae.
